v.v: Jerusalem was once full of people,
We in the city weep bitterly all during the nights,
The people of Judah have become poor
The roads to Mount Zion are empty
Our enemies are now masters of our city,
Jerusalem was a beautiful city,
We, the people of Jerusalem, are sad and have no more homes to live in;
We, the people of Jerusalem, have sinned very much;
It is as if our city has become filthy because we have sinned so greatly;
Our enemies have taken away all our treasures,
All the people in the city cry out with pain
You people who pass by,
It is as though he sent a fire from heaven
He turned the sins that I have committed into a heavy load for me to carry;
The Lord looked at my mighty soldiers, who kept me safe.
I weep because of all these things.
The people who lived in Zion (the city of Jerusalem)
But what Yahweh has done to me is fair,
I pleaded with our allies, in whom we trusted, to help,
Yahweh, see that I am suffering very much!
Hear my groaning!
Yahweh, let those evil deeds come near to you
The Lord was extremely angry with us;
The Lord destroyed the homes of the people of Judah;
Because he was extremely angry,
He has gotten ready to kill us, his people,
The Lord has become like an enemy
He has caused our enemies to smash his temple
Yahweh has rejected the very altar on which we had sacrificed animals to him;
Yahweh was determined
The city gates have collapsed;
The old men of Jerusalem sit on the ground,
My eyes are very tired because of my tears;
They cry out to their mothers,
You people of Jerusalem,
The prophets among you claimed that they had seen visions from Yahweh,
All those who pass by you
Now all our enemies laugh at you;
Yahweh has done what he planned;
I wish the city walls could speak like the people who
Get up during every night and cry out;
Yahweh, look at your people and have mercy on us.
The corpses of people of all ages lie in the streets;
You summoned my enemies to attack from every direction,
I, the one who am writing this, am a man whom Yahweh made to suffer,
It was as though he caused me to walk in a very dark place
He has punished me many times,
He has caused my skin and my flesh to become old.
He has surrounded me with things
It is as though he has buried me in a dark place
It is as though he has built a prison wall around me,
Although I call out and cry out for him to help me,
It is as though he has blocked my path with a high stone wall
He has waited to attack me
It is as though a bear has dragged me off the path and mauled me,
It is as though he strung his bow and made me the target
It is as though he shot his arrows
All my relatives laugh at me;
Yahweh has made me suffer greatly,
It is as though he has caused me to chew gravel that broke my teeth;
Things no longer go well for me;
I continue to say to myself, “I am not strong enough to bear any more hardships.
When I think about how I suffer and how I wander far from home,
I will never forget this time
However, I confidently expect Yahweh to do good things for me again,
Yahweh never stops faithfully loving us, and he shows his compassion for us forever.
Every morning he acts mercifully toward us again.
So I sincerely say to myself, “Yahweh gives me what I need!”
Yahweh is good to all those who depend on him,
So it is good for us to wait quietly
And it is good for us to suffer patiently
Those who seek him to help them should sit by themselves and not complain,
They should lie in the dirt, with their faces on the ground,
If someone strikes us on one cheek,
The Lord does not abandon his people forever.
Sometimes he causes us to suffer,
And he does not take pleasure when he causes people to suffer
If people mistreat and oppress all the prisoners,
or if they rebel against God
or if they cause judges to decide matters unjustly,
No one can make something happen
God in heaven is the one who commands that disasters should happen,
So it is certainly not right for us, who are only people on earth, to complain
Instead, we should think carefully about how we behave;
We should pray with all our inner beings and lift up our arms
“We have sinned and rebelled against you,
You have been very angry and chased after us;
You have hidden yourself away, as if you were in a cloud,
You have made us go among the foreign peoples,
All our enemies have spoken things to insult us.
We are constantly afraid that people will trap us,
Many tears flow from my eyes
My tears continually flow;
until Yahweh looks down from heaven and sees us.
I am very grieved
My enemies hunted for me
They threw me into a pit to kill me,
The water in the pit rose above my head,
But from the bottom of the pit I cried out to you,
I pleaded with you,
Then you answered me
Yahweh, you argued for me when people wanted to condemn me and execute me;
Now, Yahweh, you have seen the evil things that my enemies have done to me,
You know the evil things
Yahweh, you have heard them insult me;
Every day they whisper and mutter things about me,
Look at them! Whatever they are doing at the moment,
Yahweh, give them what they deserve!
You permit them to do whatever they want,
Because you are angry with them, pursue them and get rid of them,
Previously our people were like pure gold,
The young men of Jerusalem were as valuable as large amounts of gold,
Even the female jackals feed their pups,
My people’s infants’ tongues cling to the roofs of their mouths
People who previously ate fine food
The people of Sodom died very suddenly in a disaster.
Our leaders used to be like pure snow or white milk,
Now our leaders’ faces are blacker than soot,
It is better to die in a battle
Women who usually acted with love and compassion
Yahweh has shown to everyone how angry he was with his people!
None of the kings on the earth or anyone else
But that is what happened;
The priests and prophets wander through the streets
These people shouted at the priests and prophets, saying,
It is Yahweh himself who has scattered them;
We continued to look for someone to help us before it was too late,
Our enemies were pursuing us,
Those who ran after us were faster than eagles flying in the sky.
Our king, whom Yahweh had appointed,
You people of Edom and Uz,
You people of Zion (whose home is in Jerusalem),
Yahweh, think about what has happened to us.
Foreigners have seized our property,
Our enemies have killed our fathers,
Now they make us pay for water to drink,
The enemy runs after us and is very close to us;
In order to get enough food to remain alive,
Our ancestors sinned, and now they are dead,
Now the people who rule over us are themselves slaves to their own masters in Babylon.
We go far to look for food, but we are in danger of dying when we do so,
Our skin has become hot like an oven,
Our enemies have violated the women in Jerusalem,
Our enemies have hanged our leaders,
They force our young men to grind flour with millstones,
Our elders no longer sit at the city gates to make important decisions;
We are no longer joyful;
The wreaths of flowers have fallen off our heads.
We are tired and discouraged,
Jerusalem has no one living any more in it,
But Yahweh, you rule forever!
So why have you forgotten us?
Please enable us to return to you,
Please do that, or is it really true that you have rejected us forever?

v: but now it is completely deserted.
Once it was a powerful nation,
but now it is alone, like a widow.
Once everyone in the world honored it like a king’s daughter,
but now it is like a slave.
with tears flowing down our cheeks.
We did not trust Yahweh to help us, and the people groups that we did trust failed to help us;
none of those people comfort us now.
All the people groups that were friends with us have betrayed us;
they are all now our enemies.
and have suffered greatly.
Almost all of our people
were forced to leave our land.
We now live in another country
and we have no peace.
When the people Judah were unable to defend ourselves,
that was when our enemies captured us.
because no one comes here to celebrate the sacred festivals any longer.
No elders or leaders sit under the city gates to talk any more,
and Jerusalem’s priests groan in sorrow.
The young women left in Jerusalem cry
because they are suffering greatly.
and they prosper.
Yahweh has punished us, the people of Jerusalem,
because of all the sins that we have committed.
Our enemies have taken all our children
and made them go to other countries.
but it is not beautiful now.
The leaders of our city are like deer that are starving
because they can find no grass to eat.
They are very weak
and cannot run from our enemies.
we think about all the splendid things that once filled our city.
But now our enemies have captured the city,
and there is no one to help us.
Our enemies destroyed our city
and laughed while they were doing it.
our city has become like a bloody rag between a woman’s legs.
Everyone who previously honored our city now despise it;
they are like people who strip a woman bare and then mock her.
Now we groan in the city;
we are like a woman without clothes who tries to cover herself with her hands.
we did not think about how God would punish us.
We did not imagine how we would suffer;
there is no one to comfort us.
We all call out to God, “Yahweh, look at how we are suffering
because our enemies have defeated us!”
all the valuable things that we owned.
People who do not worship you, Yahweh, are going into our sacred temple,
where you had said no foreigner must go into the place where your people worship you.
while they search for food.
They have given their most valuable things
to get food to eat to restore their strength.
Yahweh, look at me,
no one values my life.
you do not seem to care at all about what has happened to me.
Look around and see that there are no other people who are suffering as I do.
Yahweh has caused me to suffer
because he has punished me on the day he was angry with us, his people.
that burned in my bones;
it is as though he has placed a trap to entangle my feet,
and made me turn back.
He has abandoned me;
I am weak and alone every day, all during the day.
it is as though he tied them around my neck.
Previously we were strong,
but he has caused me to become weak.
He has allowed my enemies to capture me,
and I was not able to do anything to resist them.
He summoned a great army
to come and crush me to defeat my strong young soldiers.
The Lord has trampled on the people of Judah
as people trample on grapes in a pit to make juice.
My eyes are filled with tears.
There is no one to comfort me.
The one who comforts me is far away from me.
My children have no hope
because the enemy has taken us all captive.
have no one to give them comfort.
Yahweh has given the order that the people in nearby nations
will become the enemies of the descendants of our father Jacob (who are also called the Israelites).
Jerusalem has become disgusting to them.
for I had refused to obey what he told me to do.
You people everywhere, listen to me!
Look and see that I am suffering greatly.
My young daughters and brave sons
have been taken away to far off lands.
but they all refused,
they told lies and did not keep their promises.
My priests and my leaders
died within the walls of the city
while they searched for food to eat.
Inside of my body I am in great distress.
I am sad in the center of my being,
because I have rebelled against you
and have caused you great sadness!
Our enemies kill people in the streets with their swords;
and that makes our homes the places where the dead are kept.
but no one came to comfort me.
All our enemies know what happened to me;
they were all happy to hear
about what Yahweh has done to his people.
Please do soon what you have promised,
when our enemies will suffer like we have suffered!
so you may see them all!
Punish them as you have punished me
for all my sins!
I suffer and groan very much,
and I faint within my inner self.
